intro: Stachys sendteri, commonly known as the Sierra stonecrop, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a low-growing perennial with succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in its arid habitat. The plant produces clusters of small, violet to purple flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and alpine landscapes. Stachys sendteri is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
